page.title: 10E.Horsley S. School 2.
page.content: Cranmore school is a fee-paying Roman Catholic Boys Day Preparatory school, although boys of all denominations are accepted. The school was founded in 1948, moving to Horsley in 1969. It is expanding, the latest building additions being a swimming pool and sports hall. There is a nursery class for boys 3 - 4 1/2, a preparatory dep- artment for boys 4 1/2 - 7 years and the senior school covering the ages 7 - 13. After taking Common Entrance examination, boys transfer to Public Schools all over the country. A high academic success rate is achieved but also great emphasis is placed on a wide variety of sports. Music plays an important part in school life with 3 choirs, an orchestra and other groups as well as an annual musical play.
